title: English Class With Manuela Kappel
description: In high school you learned all about the basics of the English language. This Wikiwijs is for those of you who want a recap of the basics.

items.content:
Hello, I'm happy to see you at my online English classes.

Here we will begin our introduction to English at Albeda College. At your previous school you probably learned all about the basics of the English Language. To start off the year we are going to recap some of the basics.

The goals for this lessonseries are:

  • You understand the Present Simple and are able to apply it.
  • You understand the Present Continuous and are able to apply it.
  • You know at least 10 different irregular verbs.

Let's get started. Good luck


Manuela Kappel

If you have any questions please contact me here.
Watch the following video.

prompt.body: What is your favorite fun fact from the video?

values.value: Great! My favorite fun fact is about Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.

content.body: Great! My favorite fun fact is about Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.

items.content:
How to use the Lessonseries?

We are going to start with an Entry level test and than a Common Mistake exercise.

After this we are going to start with the grammar topics.

Every topic has three levels.

  • Explanation
  • Let's practise
  • Advanced

Students who need some more explanation start with Explanation

Students who are already familiar with the topic start with Let's practise

Students who want a little bit more of a challenge start with Advanced

Topic too difficult? Go back to Explanation.

At the end you will have to fill in a form and take a test as proof of participation.

  • Goals
  • Final test

I hope you enjoy working with the lessonseries. Best of luck.

introduction.body:
You are now going do an exercise about common mistakes.

Please date my dad!

  1. Read the sentence carefully.
  2. Select the right bold word.
  3. Make sure the sentence makes sense.

content.body:
Please date my dad!

'So, how was the date?' You probably 1) think thinking thinks this is 2) a an parent 3) asking asks ask the question 4) to too two their child.

But many children are now helping 5) they're their there single parents find love, 6) too two to. Clint Bouchez, a 52-year-old businessman from Reigate, Surrey, got divorced ten years ago. 7) His Him Mine daughter, 26-year-old Charlotte, 8) do don't doesn't want her dad to end up alone.

Her mum remarried five years ago, and Charlotte 9) have has having a boyfriend. Charlotte and Clint 10) is am are very close. They often 11) go going goes out together in the evening, they're 12) planning plan plans a trip to India for later in the year.

They both 13) loving love loves music and often 14) listening listens listen Bruce Springsteen fans. But Charlotte says: "Dad, 15) you're your youre lonely and you need a new partner". Clint agrees and is open to a relationship. "Are you 16) looking look looks for a partner in life? Please, date my dad!"

Please date my dad!

'So, how was the date?' You probably 1) think thinking thinks this is 2) a an parent 3) asking asks ask the question 4) to too two their child. But many children are now helping 5) they're their there single parents find love, 6) too two to. Clint Bouchez, a 52-year-old businessman from Reigate, Surrey, got divorced ten years ago. 7) His Him Mine daughter, 26-year-old Charlotte, 8) do don't doesn't want her dad to end up alone. Her mum remarried five years ago, and Charlotte 9) have has having a boyfriend. Charlotte and Clint 10) is am are very close. They often 11) go going goes out together in the evening, they're 12) planning plan plans a trip to India for later in the year. They both 13) loving love loves music and often 14) listening listens listen Bruce Springsteen fans. But Charlotte says: "Dad, 15) you're your youre lonely and you need a new partner". Clint agrees and is open to a relationship. "Are you 16) looking look looks for a partner in life? Please, date my dad!"

questions.label: Read the whole text again and select the right words.

items.content:
When do we use the present simple?

Talking about permanent situations and facts.

For example:

  • Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.
  • I live in Rotterdam.

Talking about things that happen repeatedly.

​For example:

  • They play soccer everyday.
  • I work on the weekends.

Asking for and giving instructions.

​For example:

  • How do I get to Rotterdam centraal?
  • You turn right and take a left.

Telling stories.

​For example:

  • In the movie Twilight a girl falls in love with a vampire

Taking about future scheduled events.

​For example:

  • The meeting on Teams starts at 10:00.
  • The train leaves at 07:00.

How do we form the present simple?

We use the most basic form of the verb (simple).

​For example:

  • I walk
  • we talk
  • They run

But please remember the SHIT-rule

He, she and it need an +s

​For example:

  • He walks
  • She talks
  • It rains

There are also irregular verbs. But we will look at those in another chapter.

Need some extra explanation? Watch the following video.

introduction.body:
Let's start by finding the present simple. Pay attention to the verbs in the following sentences.

You got this!

prompt.body: I made a cake for you last night.

introduction.body: Make sure to read the explanation of the present simple.

content.body: Goedzo! Tim is een 'he' en dan is het stam+s.
Let op: Tim is een jongen. Hij behoort tot de categorie 'he'. Wat is de regel bij 'he'?
Well done! Het is alleen de stam bij 'I'.
Kijk even terug naar welk vorm van het werkwoord we gebruiken bij de present simple.
Kijk even terug naar welk vorm van het werkwoord we gebruiken bij de present simple.
Je bent 12 jaar oud. Dat is een feit. We gebruiken bij feiten de Present Simple. Bij 'to be' heb je de mogelijkheden am/is/are.
Juist! Het is een mening en bij meningen gebruiken we de Present Simple.

Lees de zin goed. Het is een mening. Bij meningen gebruiken we de Present Simple. Kijk ook goed naar het onderwerp. Het gaat over 'she', dus wat moet er met het werkwoord gebeuren? Denk aan de Shit-rule!

Hello. What your name?

Hey. My name Justin.

Where you ?

I in Rotterdam. And you?

My family from Utrecht but we in Rotterdam.

you any sports?

Yes, my sister and I basketball every weekend.

Your sister?

Yes. She basketball. She even basketball games on her computer every day.

you any hobbies?

I . I to books.

items.content: Please watch the video for an explanation on the Present Continuous.

prompt.body: I am _____ (to plan) a trip to South Africa.
I ________ (to studying) Social Work at the moment.
They _____ (to work) at a restaurant during the summer.
We _______ (to meet) my nephew at four pm.

items.content: Watch the video for an explanantion on the Present Simple vs the Present Continuous. After watching answer the question below the video.

prompt.body: What is the easiest way to know if we need to use the Present Simple in a sentence?

content.body:
No, we use this with the Present Continuous
Watch the video again for explanation

No, this is not correct
Watch the video again for explanation

header.title: Present simple vs Present continuous exercise advanced

content.body:
Hi Cristina

My name's Paloma and I live (live) in Madrid. I go to the cinema sometimes, but I (love) the theatre. What about you? you (prefer) the cinema or the theatre?

I'm a student, but it's the winter holidays, so now I (not study) - I (work) in a shop. I (want) some extra money because I'm going to visit Russia next year! I (not speak) Russian very well, so I (take) some lessons. you (learn) any languages at the moment?

Write soon

Paloma

questions.label: Write the correct words. Choose the present simple or the present continuous.

items.content: In the English language there are a lot of verbs. Regular and irregular verbs. The basic grammar rules apply to regular verbs. But they don't apply to irregular verbs and that is why we have to learn all of the irregular verbs. And that is a lot of work. So let's make it fun!

Fun Facts 1.0

World Of Knowledge - 10 Strange Facts About The English Language That You Didn't Know

https://youtu.be/djDQTQRUB8I
